title: More than 10K expected to run in Hartford races
text:
HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) - More than 10,000 runners are expected to participate Saturday in the annual Hartford Marathon and its related half-marathon and 5K races.

Race officials say they also expect about 60,000 spectators for the 26th running of the race.

The marathon starts at 8 a.m. near the state Capitol, winds its way through East Hartford and South Windsor before returning to finish under Hartford’s Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Arch.

Numerous roads in the area will be closed for the event from 7:30 a.m. until 2 p.m.

Organizers estimate the runners will complete an estimated 336 million steps and drink more than 9,400 gallons of water during the race.

They say last year’s race raised more than $300,000 for charity and had an economic impact of almost $12 million on greater Hartford.
